stance_1: I am motivated by health improvements
justification: Interviewee explicitly states that health improvements are the main motivation for eating mostly animal-based meals.

stance_1: I am motivated by health improvements
stance_2: My health improves as I eat this way
justification: The motivation for the diet is explicitly linked to continued health improvements.

stance_2: My health improves as I eat this way
justification: The interviewee explicitly credits their animal-based diet for health improvements.

stance_1: I feel current nutritional advice is misleading
justification: The interviewee chooses to eat animal-based meals partly because they distrust mainstream nutritional advice.

stance_1: I feel current nutritional advice is misleading
stance_2: My health improves as I eat this way
justification: Improved health despite going against mainstream advice implicitly supports the stance that current advice is misleading.

stance_1: I feel current nutritional advice is misleading
stance_2: I am motivated by health improvements
justification: Motivation for health improvements and success contradicts mainstream advice, reinforcing the stance that advice is misleading.

stance_1: My friends are interested in ketogenic diets
stance_2: My friends notice my health changes
justification: Friends' interest in diets is explicitly attributed to noticing the interviewee's health changes.
